intro: Psephellus coruhensis, commonly known as the Coruhensis sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Psephellus coruhensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
